alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 3:35PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A few strong thunderstorms were moving across north central Wisconsin... At 333 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking several thunderstorms across parts of Clark and Taylor Counties in north central Wisconsin. The strongest storms were near the county line and will impact the Curtiss and Abbotsford areas south of Medford by 5pm. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Colby around 355 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Highway 73 And 98, Polley, Atwood, Tioga, Perkinstown, Esadore Lake, Lynn, Eidsvold, Longwood and County Roads D And N. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
